meanings.definition: The habitual, involuntary grinding or clenching of the teeth, typically during sleep.
meanings.sent1: Her bruxisms at night often left her with a sore jaw in the morning.
meanings.sent2: Dentists recommend wearing a mouthguard to prevent bruxisms while sleeping.
meanings.sent3: The bruxisms of the tooth fairy were so loud that she woke up the whole house!
meanings.sent4: The bruxisms of time slowly wore down the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bruxisms echoed through the quiet room, like tiny pebbles rolling down a hill.

meanings.definition: The act of grinding or clenching the teeth.
meanings.sent1: His bruxisms during moments of stress were noticeable to those around him.
meanings.sent2: The dentist could see the effects of her bruxisms on her worn-down teeth.
meanings.sent3: The bruxisms of the angry bear scared away the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The constant bruxisms of the old gears in the clock tower created a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The bruxisms of the car engine signaled that it needed immediate attention.
